metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1211 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The OriginCanAccessServiceWorkers function incontent/browser/service_worker/service_worker_dispatcher_host.cc in GoogleChrome before 40.0.2214.111 on Windows, OS X, and Linux and before40.0.2214.109 on Android does not properly restrict the URI scheme during aServiceWorker registration, which allows remote attackers to gainprivileges via a filesystem: URI.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
